metadata.description: Comprehensive linguistic, demographic, and historical database for all 54 African countries
metadata.purpose: Analyze correlation between country name phonetics and international funding patterns

linguistic.endonym_meaning: Named after Benin Empire (now in Nigeria)

historical_names.name: Benin
historical_names.context: Renamed to Benin under Marxist government
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Rejected colonial name for indigenous reference

historical_names.name: Botswana
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Colonial to indigenous name at independence

colonial_history.name_change_reason: Indigenous assertion, rejection of colonial name

historical_names.name: Upper Volta
historical_names.context: French colony, then independent as Upper Volta

historical_names.name: Burkina Faso
historical_names.context: Revolutionary government renamed with indigenous meaning
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Rejected colonial geographic name for indigenous dignity

colonial_history.name_change_reason: Revolutionary anti-colonial assertion by Thomas Sankara

linguistic.endonym_meaning: From Portuguese 'Rio dos Camarões' (River of Prawns)

historical_names.name: Congo Free State
historical_names.context: Personal property of King Leopold II

historical_names.name: Zaire
historical_names.context: Renamed by Mobutu for authenticité policy
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Indigenous name during authoritarian rule

linguistic.endonym_meaning: Uncertain, possibly from Somali or Afar

historical_names.name: French Territory of the Afars and the Issas
Ethiopia
historical_names.name_change_significance: MODERATE - Shift from western exonym to endonym

historical_names.name: Gold Coast
historical_names.context: British colony named for gold trade

historical_names.name: Ghana
historical_names.context: First sub-Saharan African colony to gain independence
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Colonial commodity name to historical African empire name

colonial_history.name_change_reason: Pan-African assertion, reference to ancient Ghana Empire

historical_names.name: Guinea
historical_names.context: First French colony to gain independence

linguistic.endonym_meaning: Great House of Stone (from Great Zimbabwe ruins)

historical_names.name: Southern Rhodesia
historical_names.context: British colony named after Cecil Rhodes

historical_names.name: Zimbabwe
historical_names.context: Majority rule independence with indigenous name
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Colonial colonizer's name to ancient indigenous civilization name

colonial_history.name_change_reason: Rejection of colonial naming, reference to Great Zimbabwe

historical_names.name: Northern Rhodesia
historical_names.context: British protectorate named after Cecil Rhodes

historical_names.name: Zambia
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Colonial colonizer's name to indigenous river name

historical_names.name: Nyasaland
historical_names.context: British protectorate named after Lake Nyasa

historical_names.name: Malawi
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Colonial geographic name to indigenous people's name

historical_names.name: Tanzania
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Creation of new name from merger

historical_names.name: Mali
historical_names.context: Independence with reference to ancient Mali Empire
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Colonial geographic name to glorious pre-colonial empire

historical_names.name: Namibia
historical_names.name_change_significance: MAJOR - Colonial descriptor to indigenous desert name

historical_names.name: Ivory Coast
historical_names.context: French colony, then independent as Ivory Coast

historical_names.name: Côte d'Ivoire
historical_names.context: Government requested use of French name only
historical_names.name_change_significance: MODERATE - Endonym enforcement, rejection of English translation

linguistic.exonym_etymology: Portuguese from Swahili musa al big (island)

historical_names.name: Liberia
historical_names.context: Founded by freed American slaves, never colonized

historical_names.name: British Sierra Leone
historical_names.context: British colony, settlement for freed slaves

historical_names.name: British Somaliland/Italian Somaliland
historical_names.context: Divided between British and Italian control

linguistic.exonym_etymology: Named after Jean Moreau de Séchelles
Named after Prince Maurice of Nassau

colonial_history.name_change_reason: Rejected colonial 'land' designation, embraced indigenous name

linguistic.exonym_etymology: Portuguese names for the two islands
